items.title: What Stranger Things gets right about wormholes
bullets: • Stranger Things gets right about wormholes in the fifth season of the show

• Theoretical physicists still use it to explore scientific questions today
• The story is set in Indiana in a fictional town called Hawkins that gets caught up with a paranormal world

items.title: Something was pumping enormous energy into a young galaxy cluster
bullets: • A young galaxy cluster has been found blazing with extreme heat far earlier than expected in cosmic history
• Researchers believe supermassive black holes may have rapidly heated the surrounding gas
• The finding could force a major rethink of how galaxy clusters grow
• The cluster is filled with intensely hot gas and existed just 1.4 billion years after the Big Bang

items.title: Sick young ants send out a 'kill me' scent to prevent deadly epidemics
bullets: • Sick young ants send out a 'kill me' scent to prevent deadly epidemics in check

items.title: This brain trick makes exercise feel easier
bullets: • Scientists discovered that vibrating tendons before cycling allowed people to push harder without feeling like they were working more
• Their muscles and hearts worked overtime, but their sense of strain stayed the same
• This brain-body mismatch could one day help make exercise feel less intimidating

items.title: About 200 Texas A&M courses could change due to new restrictions on teaching gender, race
bullets: • A&M System Board of Regents approved a policy in November requiring campus presidents to sign off on courses that could be seen as advocating ‘race and gender ideology’ or topics related to sexual orientation or gender identity

• Regents revised the policy in December, barring most discussion of those topics in introductory or core curriculum courses unless administrators determine the material serves a 'necessary educational purpose'

items.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
bullets: • The pyre was found in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi
• It is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa
• In total 170 individual bone fragments – apparently from an adult woman - were discovered in two clusters

• Greenpeace said the treaty could establish the largest network of ocean sanctuaries in history
